resource_dependency.map_api: An interactive map API such as Mapbox or Leaflet for rendering neighborhood boundaries and enabling area selection.
resource_dependency.charting_library: A JavaScript charting library such as Chart.js or D3.js for rendering interactive charts.

function: Fetch all dynamic data from backend APIs for use in the frontend application.
static_description: The frontend loads without displaying any hard-coded data. All visualizations, maps, and dashboards remain blank until populated via API responses.

interaction_and_states.description: Triggers automatic fetching of available neighborhood data, demographic summaries, and default dashboard configurations from backend APIs.

resource_dependency.postgresql_database: Set up a PostgreSQL database with tables: neighborhoods(area_id, name, boundary_polygon), demographics(area_id, population, age_distribution, income_median), economics(area_id, employment_rate, business_count, avg_income), crimes(area_id, total_incidents, incident_types, year)

function: Establish secure database connections using provided environment variables and handle potential connection errors gracefully.
static_description: Backend initializes but remains idle until an API request triggers a database query.

interaction_and_states.description: Establishes a new database connection using environment variables and executes queries based on endpoint logic.
Logs the error internally and returns a standardized HTTP 500 response indicating database connectivity issues.

resource_dependency.map_api: An interactive map API such as Mapbox or Leaflet for rendering neighborhood boundaries and enabling area selection.

function: Display neighborhood boundaries and enable user interaction to select areas for further analysis.
static_description: A full-width interactive map centered on the region of interest, showing outlined neighborhood boundaries with labels.

interaction_and_states.description: Selects or deselects a neighborhood polygon. Selected polygons are visually highlighted with a border or fill color change.
Displays a tooltip with basic information about the hovered neighborhood such as name and area ID.

resource_dependency.demographic_data_schema: Table schema: area_id (foreign key), population (integer), age_distribution (JSON), income_median (float)
resource_dependency.economic_data_schema: Table schema: area_id (foreign key), employment_rate (float), business_count (integer), avg_income (float)
resource_dependency.crime_data_schema: Table schema: area_id (foreign key), total_incidents (integer), incident_types (JSON), year (integer)

function: Allow users to compare selected neighborhoods based on demographic, economic, and crime statistics.
static_description: Comparison panel displayed below or beside the map, showing tabbed sections for Demographics, Economics, and Crime. Each section lists metrics side-by-side for selected neighborhoods.

interaction_and_states.description: Changes displayed data view between Demographics, Economics, and Crime tabs dynamically updating the table content.
Includes additional neighborhood row in the comparison table after selection on the map.
Removes a selected neighborhood from the comparison table when deselected on the map or removed via UI control.

resource_dependency.charting_library: A JavaScript charting library such as Chart.js or D3.js for rendering interactive charts.

function: Provide interactive data dashboards for visualizing demographic, economic, and crime trends per area.
static_description: Dashboard grid layout containing multiple resizable chart widgets, each representing one dataset category (e.g., population distribution pie chart, income bar graph). Widgets show sample loading placeholders before data load.

interaction_and_states.description: Activates focus mode expanding the widget to occupy most screen space while hiding others.
Highlights corresponding data series within the chart for easier identification.
Allows resizing of individual chart containers through drag handles located at corners.

resource_dependency.layout_options_data: Predefined layout templates stored either client-side or fetched from backend (lightweight JSON structures defining widget positions and sizes)

function: Enable users to customize their dashboard layout by rearranging and resizing widgets.
static_description: Dashboard displays widgets arranged according to a default template. Controls appear upon hover allowing movement or resizing actions.

interaction_and_states.description: Initiates dragging operation on a widget allowing repositioning within the grid system.
Finalizes widget placement at the drop location and updates internal layout configuration.
Adjusts dimensions of a widget proportionally and notifies other adjacent widgets accordingly.
Stores current layout preferences locally or sends them to the backend for persistence.

function: Apply consistent styling throughout the application using ivory background and forest green components.
static_description: Entire page uses #FFFFF0 as the base background color. Buttons, headers, cards, and navigation bars utilize #228B22 as primary accent color.

interaction_and_states.description: Applies subtle darkening effect to #228B22 colored elements enhancing interactivity feedback.

resource_dependency.demographic_data_schema: Table schema: area_id (foreign key), population (integer), age_distribution (JSON), income_median (float)

function: Expose RESTful API endpoints to retrieve demographic data filtered by geographic area identifiers.
static_description: Endpoint accessible at /api/demographics/{areaId} returning structured JSON response including all relevant demographic fields.

resource_dependency.economic_data_schema: Table schema: area_id (foreign key), employment_rate (float), business_count (integer), avg_income (float)

function: Serve economic data through dedicated API routes indexed by area identifier.
static_description: Accessible endpoint at /api/economics/{areaId} delivering JSON formatted economic indicators related to the specified area.

resource_dependency.crime_data_schema: Table schema: area_id (foreign key), total_incidents (integer), incident_types (JSON), year (integer)

function: Deliver crime-related datasets grouped by area via standardized API interfaces.
static_description: Endpoint available at /api/crimes/{areaId} responding with detailed criminal activity records tied to the requested area.

resource_dependency.charting_library: A JavaScript charting library such as Chart.js or D3.js for rendering interactive charts.

function: Implement reusable UI components capable of rendering various types of data-driven charts.
static_description: Reusable React/Vue components wrapping chart libraries with props accepting chart type, data source URL, and customization settings.

interaction_and_states.description: Re-renders chart visuals automatically when underlying data changes or new data arrives from API calls.

resource_dependency.neighborhood_selection_ui_elements: Buttons, checkboxes, or multi-select dropdown menus used to choose which neighborhoods will be compared.

function: Facilitate intuitive area selection mechanisms integrated into map controls or separate panels.
static_description: Panel alongside or above the map featuring searchable list of neighborhoods with checkboxes next to each entry for toggling inclusion in comparisons.

interaction_and_states.description: Marks/unmarks a neighborhood for inclusion in comparative views and synchronizes with map highlights.
Filters visible neighborhood entries in real time matching typed keywords against area names.

resource_dependency.responsive_css_framework: CSS framework like Bootstrap or Tailwind CSS supporting adaptive layouts across device sizes.

function: Ensure optimal viewing experience across desktop and tablet screen resolutions.
static_description: Flexible grid layouts adjusting column counts and font sizes depending on viewport width. Navigation transforms into collapsible menu on smaller screens.

interaction_and_states.description: Dynamically adjusts element sizing and arrangement maintaining usability and readability regardless of orientation or resolution.

function: Configure package.json scripts to manage installation and development server startup processes efficiently.
static_description: Scripts defined under 'scripts' key in package.json file ensuring simultaneous setup of frontend and backend environments.

interaction_and_states.description: `npm run install:all` runs npm install in both frontend and backend directories concurrently. `npm run dev` launches watchers and servers for live reloading during development.

function: Manage database connections robustly with built-in retry logic and clear error reporting.
static_description: Backend module establishes persistent pool of database connections initialized at app boot utilizing provided credentials.

interaction_and_states.description: Acquires free connection from pool, performs SQL execution, releases back to pool once done preventing leaks.
Retries failed operations up to configured limit before throwing exception caught globally for logging and HTTP response generation.
